metadata.title: CVE-2023-46846 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
SQUID is vulnerable to HTTP request smuggling, caused by chunked decoderlenience, allows a remote attacker to perform Request/Response smugglingpast firewall and frontend security systems.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-46846` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

squid - 5.7-0ubuntu0.22.04.2
squid-cgi - 5.7-0ubuntu0.22.04.2
squid-common - 5.7-0ubuntu0.22.04.2
squid-openssl - 5.7-0ubuntu0.22.04.2
squid-purge - 5.7-0ubuntu0.22.04.2
squidclient - 5.7-0ubuntu0.22.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: squid package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7-0ubuntu0.22.04.2').
